cause.description:
You should join this cause if you believe the following 2 things:
1. When we vote for the President of the United States, everyone’s vote should count equally, regardless of what state the vote was cast in.
2. When we vote, our votes should be the final word on who’s elected President, not the votes of a group of electors.
It seems like in a great Democracy like the United States, these are things that should obviously be true about how we elect our President, but currently they aren’t. Under the current system, a person’s vote counts for more if it’s cast in a swing state than if it’s cast in a solid Red or Blue state. It also counts for more if it’s cast in a state with a small population than if it’s cast in a state with a large population. Furthermore, our votes don’t actually elect the President. Instead, he or she is elected by a body of electors who are supposed to vote for who we voted for, but who don’t have to. I personally believe that all of these things are deep flaws in our system. If you agree, you should join this cause and make a donation.
As an added bonus, you should also note that your donation will be going towards a variety of other election reforms supported by Fairvote.org, including an instant run-off system, which would make it easier for third party candidates to get a fair shot in Presidential elections.
1. Everyone's vote should count equally in Presidential elections.
2. The President should be elected directly by the people, not by a group of electors.
3. The United States should adopt a run-off system for Presidential elections.
cause.mission: Abolish the Electoral College system in the United States, and replace it with a direct vote for the Presidency.
cause.name: Abolish the Electoral College!
